Others: rain interrupted South Africa's chase of 186 against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 match
South Africa were 69 for 4 at the end of 9 overs, 16 runs behind the DLS par score of 85
Shadab Khan hit a 22-ball 52 and picked up 2 wickets
South Africa lost opener Quinton de Kock (0) and Rilee Rossouw (7) after a wonderful new-ball spell from Shaheen Afridi
Temba Bavuma showed signs of return to form with a stunning 36 from 19 balls
